answerText: moment of inertia[10] This theorem gives the moment of inertia through an axis not passing through the center of mass. It states that I equals I sub cm plus m r squared, where r is the distance from the old axis to the new one.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | 7 | 12 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This quantity is equal to the integral of the density function times the square of the radius vector over a space. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this value symbolized I, the rotational equivalent of mass. Multiplying it by the angular velocity gives the angular momentum.
